issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Currently, if we want to run custom script at DS. We can do it like this :
--shell_command sh --shell_script custom_script.sh
But it may be better to separate running shell_command and shell_script
fields.summary: Distributed Shell should not run other commands except "sh", and run the custom script at the same time.

comments.body:
Currently, if we want to run custom script at DS. We can do it like this :
--shell_command sh --shell_script custom_script.sh

We could let DS either execute shell_commands option or shell_script option. 
The right DS commandline should be that we provide either --shell_command or --shell_script.
If we provide both options, we can throw out exception, and say something like  "Do not provide both options at the same time".

Why are you passing an extra resource now? Shouldn't be needed.

We also need to make sure that the shell used is cross-platform.
If it runs in Windows Env, we will convert the shellscript to bat script, and use cmd /c to launch it

Is it safe to presume /bin/bash exist in any Linux machine?
Uploaded the wrong patch, YARN-1435.3.patch should be the right one

bq. 2. Maybe it's good to change the hardcoded variables bellow to static? And some others in Client.java?

Those variables will be used in App.java or Client.java only. I think it should be fine to define as final

bq. You may want to comment why in windows, the output can not be assert line-by-line.

Added

bq. Can we use copyFromLocal as well for Windows?

Tested and changed
